title: Kenya: COTU Denies Bid to Undermine Boss of Dock Workers Union
text:
Kenya: Divide and Conquer 
However, Cotu deputy secretary general Carolyne Ruto termed the allegations absurd. 
"If Sang cannot run his own union, let him not drag Cotu's name in his battles," she told the Star on the phone yesterday. 
Ruto said Sang is a weak leader and should not feel threatened if he believes he has been running the dock workers affairs correctly. 
"We are dealing with grown ups. There is no grown up that you can tell this thing is yellow while he knows that it is blue," she said. 
A section of rebel DWU members, led by Geoffrey Mareko, have called for a special conference to elect new union officials on August 15 at the Bandari college. 
Sang said: "This was engineered by the other labour centre. They are living in the past. We know who is pushing for that. It is [Cotu secretary general Francis] Atwoli." 
He said Cotu will not succeed in destroying DWU. 
Sang said Mareko and his group do not have the authority to call for a special conference. Kenya
